title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12 ยง 363.3 - Normal workday and normal workweek for computing disability benefits
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12 ยง 363.3 - Normal workday and normal workweek for computing disability benefits

State Regulations

Any day on which an employee regularly or customarily
performs any work for a covered employer shall be deemed a normal workday. Normal workdays for purposes of computing daily disability benefits shall be
the number of workdays usual to the employment in which the employee is or was
last employed before disability. In the absence of such a normal workweek, or
in the case of employees entitled to collect benefits from the special fund in
accordance with the provisions of section
207
of the Workers' Compensation Law, the normal workweek shall be deemed to be

Monday to Friday inclusive. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12
ยง
363.3

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
